The four ways of taking up practices [mn: The way of taking up practices that is painful now and results in future pain
The way of taking up practices that is pleasant now but results in future pain
The way of taking up practices that is painful now but results in future pleasure
The way of taking up practices that is pleasant now and results in future pleasure
The actions that lead to each way of tak: Killing living creatures, stealing, committing sexual misconduct, using false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical speech, being covetous, malicious, and having wrong view
Killing living creatures, stealing, committing sexual misconduct, using false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical speech, being covetous, malicious, and having wrong view
Not killing living creatures, not stealing, not committing sexual misconduct, not using false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical speech, being contented, kind-hearted, and having right view
Not killing living creatures, not stealing, not committing sexual misconduct, not using false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical speech, being contented, kind-hearted, and having right view
Examples to illustrate each way of takin: Bronze cup of beverage mixed with poison
Fermented urine mixed with different medicines
Curds, honey, ghee, and molasses all mixed together
